author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: مآءِ قَدْ تَحَيَّرَ أُولُوا النُّهَى مِنْ بَحْرِ عِلْمِكَ وَسَمآءِ حِكْمَتِكَ وَشَمْسِ فَضْلِكَ، إِنَّ الَّذِيْ خُلِقَ بِإِرادَتِكَ كَيْفَ يَقْدِرُ أَنْ يَعْ
translation: By Thy life, O Thou the Possessor of all names! The minds of the profoundest thinkers are sore perplexed as they contemplate the ocean of Thy knowledge, and the heaven of Thy wisdom, and the Luminary of Thy grace. How can he who is but a creation of Thy will claim to know what is with Thee, or to conceive Thy nature?
